definitions.definition: following one after another in a continuous series

examples.text: She was absent for nine consecutive days.
He is beginning his fourth consecutive term of office.
After six consecutive defeats, the team was almost ready to give up.
Interest rates rose again for the fifth consecutive month.
They achieved their third consecutive year of record sales.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French consécutif, -ive, from medieval Latin consecutivus, from Latin consecut- ‘followed closely’, from the verb consequi.
